meanings.definition: The dark green substance forming the first feces of a newborn infant.
meanings.sent1: The nurse checked the baby's diaper for any meconium.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that meconium is a normal part of a newborn's digestive system.
meanings.sent3: The meconium in the diaper made the new parents giggle at its unusual color.
meanings.sent4: The meconium in the diaper was a sign that the baby's digestive system was working properly.
meanings.sent5: The meconium in the diaper was a strange but fascinating sight for the family.

meanings.definition: The earliest discharge from the intestines of a mammal.
meanings.sent1: The vet examined the meconium of the newborn puppy to ensure its health.
meanings.sent2: The meconium of a baby whale is different from that of a human infant.
meanings.sent3: The meconium of the baby rabbit was so tiny compared to the adult's.
meanings.sent4: The meconium of the newborn kitten symbolized the beginning of its life outside the womb.
meanings.sent5: The meconium of the baby deer was a sign that it was ready to start nursing.
